title: Chained consumer price index of all urban consumers 2000 to 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing December value in the x axis and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in the y axis.
The Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) is appeared to be the highest at December value 2019 and lowest at December value 2000.
There is a difference of 42.13 between the maximum December value 2019 and minimum December value 2000.
min_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing December value, and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in each December value on the y axis.
The Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) is highest at December value 2019 and lowest at December value 2000.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing December value in the x axis and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in the y axis.
The Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) is appeared to be the highest at December value 2019 and lowest at December value 2000.
There is a difference of 42.13 between the maximum December value 2019 and minimum December value 2000.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) for 20 number of December values.
The maximum Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) 144.73 is found at December value 2019 and the minimum is found at 2000 where December value is 102.6.
The difference of Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) between the highest and lowest December value is 42.13.
The December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100), followed by 2018, and 2017. Down to the December value 2000 which is the lowest.
The highest value 144.73 at 2019 is almost 1.17 times larger than the average value 124.19.
